about: My name is Gabriele Aquaro and I am a computer engineer specialized in Machine Learning and Artificial intelligence. I have also a strong background in software development.
I graduated at Polytechnic of Milan in 2021 and in the same period I started working as a software developer at Cisco Systems, where I am still working on optical network controllers.
While I was attending university I used to be a professional Track and Field Athlete. During these times, I represented the Italian Team in multiple occasion. ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹
I love all sports and still play a lot of them to keep my work-life balanced.

abilities.title: ML Engineer
abilities.text: During Master degree I have focused on Machine Learning and AI techniques. I obtained a strong theoretical base and got to challenge myself on various projects in this area.

abilities.title: Full Stack Developer
abilities.text: I have worked as a Freelance SE during university years and at Cisco after graduation. I like to work as full stack developer becasue it allows to see the 'full-scope' of an idea: from the problem to the solution.

abilities.title: Problem Solving
abilities.text: I am an engineer: I always remember that when I write my code. I think it's better to study the problem before starting the implementation.

abilities.title: Time Managment
abilities.text: I have been a professional athlete during my university years, I used to schedule 10 training sessions a week and my exams. I can handle your problems too.

abilities.title: Learning Enthusiast
abilities.text: I love learning new stuff. Both on my personal project and during my work, I'm always prone to study or to learn from others.

abilities.title: Goal Focused
abilities.text: I give my best when my objective is clear: You can't solve a problem without knowing it.

citation.author: Douglas Hofstadter
citation.text: Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.

cnn.title: Deep learning project
cnn.description: During my last  year of university, as a project assignment, we used various techniques to develoe CNN for classificaiton, segmentation and Question aswering. In particoular we developed one system to calssify wich pixels in an image were 'plant'/'grass' or background. This experience gave me a good confidence with Tensorflow and keras, bootsting also my ability in evaluating models. In particular for the segmentation problem, we fine-tuned a UNET network, because some times you have to acknoledge that the state of the art is called so for a reason.

cisco.title: Cisco Systems
cisco.description: At Cisco I work on optical network controllers. Here I'm getting more experience as a developer, working on professional softwares in a big team. During my average day I have to work on multiple projects, going from Python backend, to React frontend, passing throught Tensorflow.

theme.title: Theme Toool
theme.description: I collaboarated with Eni S.p.a to develope an application from scratch to substitute their old evaluation system. This Electron app guides the user in the evaluation and it shows the results. It also allows to store the report, export it and visualize the history of the reports.

platformer.title: WebGL Platformer
platformer.description: For one university project, I implemented using minimal js (no libraries) a minimal platformer game, that can also be played below. It uses webGl library to render the 3d environment. Physics and Shaders have been also build from zero.

connect4.title: Connect-4
connect4.description: In one of my first projects, I implemented the classical minmax algorithm for solving "Connect-4" game. This was one of my first approach to Python and AI in general.

adrenalina.title: Adrenalina
adrenalina.description: As final project of my buchelor degree, we had to implement an online multiplayer board game called 'Adrenalina'. We used Java and we had to implement a CLI, a GUI and the networking to be able to paly with other players in yuor LAN.

name: Gabriele Aquaro
